page.title: 12ST.MARTINS MINERS' INSTITUTE
page.content: {The Institute}was built in{1932}and it was used by{miners}for{leisure activities.A bar has been installed. The committee consists of four trustees, eleven committee members, a secretary and a treasurer. They meet once a month to take decisions. Although the mine has closed,the{club still flourishes.They have{teams}for {billiards,darts,dominoes,pool}and {bowls.}Once a week they have{bingo. {The Womens Institute}meet there once a month and the{Darby and Joan Club}meet once a week.{The Ifton Silver Band}is also organised through the{Institute. The hall can be hired for parties but outside firms do the catering. The club is{open all day}but closes from{5.00.p.m. until 7.00.p.m.}A pint of Wrexham lager costs 67p.The busiest time is at the weekend,but it is quiet on Tuesday and Thursday.
